result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court will allow the termination of probation after 6 months if all terms are met

miscConds.notes: COURT WILL ALLOW THE TERMINATION OF PROBATION AFTER 6 MONTHS IF ALL TERMS ARE MET
COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION

- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Perform 25 hours of community service.
- Maintain full time employment/school.
- Complete a course in anger management.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILIED. OS

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has not received video within time frame giaven.  State to turn over video on or before the next court date.  Court will not dismiss a gun case.  Defense to file written motion.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense is missing some discovery.  Court ordered the State to turn over the video within 14 days.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is Public Defender eligible.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas L Williams in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant declined an interview with the public defender's office and stated that he is in the process of hiring a private attorney.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM016541  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/29/2015
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
